intro: Ampelygonum molle, commonly known as the soft amplygonum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
